start.speaker: Mira
start.text: Oh! Sir knight. I'm sorry, I didn't see you there. Is there... is there something you need?

choices.text: I'm investigating the chapel theft. Do you know anything?
Just passing through. How are you?

theft_question.speaker: Mira
theft_question.text: The... the theft? I heard about it, of course. Everyone's talking. Those candlesticks. I don't know anything about it, sir. I clean the chapel sometimes, but I would never—

choices.text: You seem nervous. Is there something you want to tell me?
I'm not accusing you. I'm asking if you saw anything.
The guilty always protest too much.

nervous_response.speaker: Mira
nervous_response.text: I... I'm always nervous around knights. You have swords. And authority. And... please, sir. My mother is sick. If I lose this position...

choices.text: What does your mother have to do with the theft?
I understand. I grew up common too.

confession_lead.speaker: Mira
confession_lead.text: Nothing! I... I just... [she breaks down] I needed the money. For medicine. I was going to pay it back, I swear. I know where to sell things, from before I worked here. Please. Please don't tell them.

choices.text: I have to report what I've learned.
Maybe we can figure something out.

evidence_location.speaker: Mira
evidence_location.text: I haven't sold them yet. They're hidden in the servants' quarters, under a loose board near my bed. I couldn't... I couldn't do it. They're so beautiful, and they're meant for God.

evidence_obtained.speaker: Mira
evidence_obtained.text: What will you do, sir knight? My fate is in your hands.

must_report.speaker: Mira
must_report.text: I understand. I knew... I knew this would happen eventually. Do what you must, sir.

help_offer.speaker: Mira
help_offer.text: You... you would help me? Why? I'm just a servant. I'm nothing.

choices.text: Everyone deserves a chance to make things right.
Maybe someday you can return the favor.

noble_response.speaker: Mira
noble_response.text: I've never met a knight like you. Thank you. I'll return the candlesticks — put them somewhere they'll be found. And I'll find another way to help my mother. Somehow.

pragmatic_response.speaker: Mira
pragmatic_response.text: I'm just a servant, but... servants hear things. See things. If you ever need information, I can be your eyes and ears in places knights don't go.

reassure_response.speaker: Mira
reassure_response.text: I... thank you for saying that. I did see something, actually. Lord Harlan's page was in the chapel that night. Late. I thought it was strange.

accusation_response.speaker: Mira
accusation_response.text: [Her face hardens] Then you've already decided, haven't you? What does it matter what I say? Do what you came to do, knight.

friendly_chat.speaker: Mira
friendly_chat.text: You're... asking how I am? That's kind of you, sir. I'm well enough. Tired — there's always more work than hands — but I shouldn't complain.

rude_response.speaker: Mira
rude_response.text: Yes, sir. Of course, sir. [She steps aside, eyes downcast]

sympathy_response.speaker: Mira
sympathy_response.text: You did? But you're a knight now. You made it out. I thought... I thought all knights were born to it.

choices.text: My family had nothing. I earned my place through training and luck.
That's not important right now. The theft?

backstory_share.speaker: Mira
backstory_share.text: Then maybe there's hope for my brother. He's clever — cleverer than me. Maybe he could train, like you did? [She pauses] I'm sorry. You didn't come here for my family troubles.

theft_redirect.speaker: Mira
theft_redirect.text: Right. The theft. [Her nervousness returns] I really don't know anything, sir.

greeting_hostile.speaker: Mira
greeting_hostile.text: [She avoids your eyes] Sir knight. What do you want?

hostile_talk.speaker: Mira
hostile_talk.text: Talk? After what you did? I don't think we have anything to say to each other.
